stanza.line: Devouring Time blunt thou the lion pawspaws
And make the earth devour her own sweet broodbrood
Pluck the keen teeth from the fierce tiger jawsjaws
And burn the long-lived phoenix in her bloodblood
Make glad and sorry seasons as thou fleetfleet
And do whateer thou wilt swift-footed TimeTime
To the wide world and all her fading sweetssweets
But I forbid thee one most heinous crimecrime
O carve not with thy hours my love fair browbrow
Nor draw no lines there with thine antique penpen
Him in thy course untainted do allowallow
For beauty pattern to succeeding menmen
Yet do thy worst old Time despite thy wrongwrong
My love shall in my verse ever live youngyoung
